page.title: 09A FARMER'S DAY IN WHARFEDALE
page.content: On the 17th of June 1985{Mr.J.M {Harrison}and his son,from{Old Hall {Farm,Threshfield,}got up at 7am.,to move some{Friesian cows}from the middle of{Threshfield}to up above {Grassington.}He drove back to the{farm to feed some{young calves.}At about 10.30am he hitched up the horse box and loaded his{bull}and drove him up to the cows that he had already moved earlier.Next he started to put the polythene on to the sides of the{silo {pit}ready for the{yearly harvest}which will be starting in about a week. After having dinner he drove to{Stony {Pasture}to wall a gap where some{ sheep had jumped over. Finding out that there were no beefnuts for the'beef'bulls he drove to{Skipton to}get some. To end the day{Mr.J.M Harrison}went up to the house for tea.
